com.github.moribund.objects.nonplayable.projectile

Class Projectile

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.moribund.objects.nonplayable.projectile.Projectile
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Drawable, Flaggable, Movable

    public class Projectile
extends java.lang.Object
implements Movable, Drawable, Flaggable
    A Projectile is not a singular Sprite, rather it is any Sprite that is moving and visible in the screen that is not attached to a InputProcessor.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      The list of Flag for its Flaggable attribute.

      The speed at which the Projectile can move forward or back.

      The speed at which the Projectile can rotate left or right.

      The sprite of the Projectile.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Projectile

        Projectile(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Sprite sprite,
           float startingX,
           float startingY,
           float startingAngle,
           float rotationSpeed,
           float movementSpeed)
        Creates a new Projectile with a multitude of initial settings. It is important to note that in this constructor, a Projectile is automatically marked with the FlagConstants.MOVE_FORWARD_FLAG flag.

    • Method Detail

      • launchProjectile

        public static void launchProjectile(Projectile projectile)
        A helper method made for launching projectiles. Rather than making the person who wishes to launch a projectile go through the hassle of adding the projectile to the list of Flaggable and Drawable objects, this helper method takes the projectile and does it for them.
        Parameters:
        projectile - The respective Projectile that is about to be launched.

      • builder

        public static ProjectileBuilder builder()
        Calls the ProjectileBuilder as an API to construct a Projectile.
        Returns:
        The newly created ProjectileBuilder.
